metadata.titel_preek: The Great Promise: Rest for Your Soul

kernfrasen: yoke was something you put on a beast of burden
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: DISCIPLESHIP IS BEING YOKED TO A MASTER

kernfrasen: New York City was started as a trading post

mapping_structuur.doel_element: The teachings and authority of Jesus

cognitieve_implicaties: Submission is inevitable; one is always pulling for someone.
theologische_implicaties: Christ's Lordship is total and encompasses all of life.
ethische_implicaties: Obedience to biblical commands is the path to peace.
onbedoelde_consequenties: Potential for image of God as a 'driver' or 'user' of humans.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Keller revitalizes this dead metaphor by explaining the physical reality of the ox and the social reality of ancient discipleship.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher successfully links the 'yoke' (submission) with the 'child' (dependence) by arguing that true rest comes from submitting to a gentle master rather than an abusive one.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The 'yoke' represents the external structure of discipleship, while the 'child' represents the internal posture of the heart.

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-activates the source domain of the 'yoke' by contrasting it with modern New York work culture.
sterktes.voorbeeld: New York City was started as a trading post... it's set up for work.

risicos.beschrijving: The 'child' metaphor risks infantilizing the believer's intellectual responsibility.
risicos.voorbeeld: You have to admit your spiritual helplessness.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregants may avoid mature theological reflection in favor of emotionalism.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A high-pressure, workaholic Manhattan professional environment.
sub_worlds: The cosmic courtroom of the Cross

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High; creates emotional contrast between the 'rest' of the believer and the 'restlessness' of Christ.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Using the 'helpless child' metaphor to describe the human condition.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Argues that autonomy is a 'veil of illusion' and that everyone is yoked to something.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Fits the 'Ministry Year' kickoff by establishing identity in Christ over performance.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the tension between the 'Crushing Yoke' of secular performance and the 'Easy Yoke' of Christ. It effectively uses the Child metaphor to provide the 'how-to' for the Yoke metaphor.

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Use the REM sleep analogy more deeply.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The soul needs a 'Rapid Eye Movement' where it looks only at Christ to truly recover.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The transition from 'helpless child' to 'disciplined student' (yoke).
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Explicitly state that the child grows into the student while maintaining the same father-relationship.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: God might be seen as indulgent of 'bad behavior' like the 4:30 AM child.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Balance with the 'Master' entailment of the yoke to ensure holiness is maintained.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To describe the 'foundation' of rest versus the 'scaffolding' of works.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using CMT to deconstruct secular identity and reconstruct a Christocentric one.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: Instead of just praising the 'beauty' of the yoke imagery, CMT reveals how the yoke functions as a cognitive map for Lordship.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Moves beyond 'feeling' or 'doing' to the underlying conceptual structures of how the hearer perceives their own agency.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: Reveals that the preacher's strategy is to prove that 'Absolute Freedom' is a cognitively impossible category.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'CONTAINER' schema (in Christ, in the world) and 'FORCE' schema (crushing burdens vs. easy yoke).
